title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes .. - Collection 33 (Russia 8)
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 33 (Russia 8):

We have 25 titles here:

-  Adelman (Ed.) - Terror and Communist Politics; the Role of the Secret Police in Communist States (1984)

-  Allworth (Ed.) - Central Asia; 130 Years of Russian Dominance, a Historical Overview, 3e (1994)

-  Allworth (Ed.) - The Tatars of Crimea; Return to the Homeland, 2e (1998)

-  Amnesty Int. - Beaten Up for Speaking Out; Attacks on Human Rights Defenders in the Russian Federation (2011)

-  Amnesty Int. - Summary Killings During the Conflict in Eastern Ukraine (2014)

-  Boterbloem - Life and Death under Stalin; Kalinin Province, 1945-1953 (1999)

-  Clowes - Russia on the Edge; Imagined Geographies and Post-Soviet Identity (2011)

-  Davies - Popular Opinion in Stalin's Russia; Terror, Propaganda and Dissent, 1934-1941 (1997)

-  Draskoczy - Belomor; Criminality and Creativity in Stalin's Gulag (2014)

-  Fedor - Russia and the Cult of State Security; the Chekist Tradition, from Lenin to Putin (2011)

-  Garrels - Putin Country; a Journey into the Real Russia (2016)

-  Hodos - Show Trials; Stalinist Purges in Eastern Europe, 1948-1954 (1987)

-  Jelavich - Russia's Balkan Entanglements (1991)

-  Le Huerou et al (Eds.) - Chechnya at War and Beyond (2014)

-  McAuley - Human Rights in Russia; Citizens and the State from Perestroika to Putin (2015)

-  McDermott & Stibbe (Eds.) - De-Stalinising Eastern Europe; the Rehabilitation of Stalin's Victims after 1953 (2015)

-  Meier - Black Earth; a Journey Through Russia after the Fall (2003)

-  Mukhamet Shayakhmetov -The Silent Steppe_ The Story of a Kazakh Nomad Under Stalin (2006)

-  Politkovskaya - Putin's Russia; Life in a Failing Democracy (2004)

-  Sasse - The Crimea Question; Identity, Transition, and Conflict (2007)

-  Shelley - Policing Soviet Society; the Evolution of State Control (1996)

-  Taylor - State Building in Putin's Russia; Policing and Coercion after Communism (2011)

-  Uehling - Beyond Memory; the Crimean Tatars' Deportation and Return (2004)

-  Williams - Inferno in Chechnya; the Russian-Chechen Wars, the Al-Qaeda Myth, and the Boston Marathon Bombings (2015)

-  Zimmerman - Ruling Russia; Authoritarianism from the Revolution to Putin (2014)
